comments:
At times in the Java editor, the cursor will "reverse its behavior" in that 
the cursor increments to the left, rather than the right, after a key press.  
This may be text input, deletion or backspace.  In the case of text input to 
the editor, the cursor jumps to the left of the character input, so 
typing "for" yields "rof", with the cursor ending to the left of the new 
text.  The behavior disappears if the editor window is closed and reopened.

Is there a special key that's maybe putting your input method into right-to-left
mode?

How can I reproduce this bug ?
Do you have support for right-to-left languages (arabic, hebrew, farsi, etc) 
installed on your computer ?

(In reply to comment #1)
> Is there a special key ...

That has been the suspicion here, as it is not a situation that I alone have 
experienced.

(In reply to comment #2)
> How can I reproduce this bug ?

I wish I knew, so that I could AVOID it myself.

> Do you have support for right-to-left languages...

No, I do not.

Created an attachment (id=28437)
Lates .log file containing the stack trace

The latest .log entries are attached.
The NPE is not in SWT, moving this problem to Text.

Happens in SSE.

Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at

	... 37 more

I'm suspecting (hoping) the fixes we put in place for bug 108325 will fix this
also, but, I'll admit, there's other "funny stuff" in this log which might be a
different bug? But I think the "backwards typing" per se, is fixed in 0.7.1. 

If you are seeing this on 0.7.1 of WTP, please re-open. 
If you do re-open, please attach sample input of the type 
of files you see this with. I assume its JSP? 

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 108325 ***

I have started to see this issue again in v3.2.  This afternoon this occured in a JSP editor when I started to type the JSP delimiter (within a JavaScript block).
